boardgame.name: Ukraine _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;43
boardgame.description: On August 3rd, 1943, less than two weeks after the Kursk offensive, the Soviets launched a massive offensive near Kharkov that ripped open the German line. The ensuing battle began their summer offensive that would take them across the Ukraine to the Dnieper River._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;During August the two sides were equally matched and a tremendous war of attrition raged from Kharkov to the Sea of Azov with neither side willing to give ground. In September, bled white by the never-ending Soviet attacks, the German army retreated in haste to the safety of the Dnieper River. In October, the battle raged along the length of the Dnieper and for the Perekop Peninsula, the only land exit to the German 17th Army in the Crimea. During this three month period German reinforcements poured in from every sector, but it was never enough. Three Soviet Tank Armies and four Soviet Fronts ground through nineteen panzer and panzergrenadier divisions. German and Soviet losses were staggering. Kiev, the capital of the Ukraine, fell on November 6th._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;[1st edition]_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Ukraine '43 attempts to simulate this important campaign in a moderately complex game. The design uses the conventional move-fight-exploit sequence of play and the popular Zone of Control Bond rules. Soviet tank armies and German panzer corps spearhead constant attacks and counterattacks. With both sides able to attack, the game becomes a tense battle of skill and nerves._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Game Features:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; German Panzer Corps/Russian Tank Army capabilities_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Soviet massed artillery_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; German tactical proficiency_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; German Tiger tanks_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Soviet sappers_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; air power_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; differing capabilities for Marshal Zhukov and General Manstein_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; and, Zone of Control Bonds_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;COMPONENTS (1st edition)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 280 full-color counters_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; One 22x29_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; full-color mapsheet and one 5x29_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; full-color mapsheet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 32-page Rule Book_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 2 full-color 11x17 Player Aid Cards_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 1 8.5x11 Sequence of Play Card (w/ Historical Setup on the reverse side!)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Three 6-sided dice _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;[2nd Edition]The 2nd Edition has been re-designed to play much faster using the system used in France '40 and Normandy '44. Players familiar with those games will find the new Ukraine '43 very easy to learn. All the components will be upgraded -- the counters will go from half-inch to 9/16 size, the map will be enlarged so the hexes can accommodate the larger counters, and each scenario will now come with a setup card to facilitate setting up the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;NEW FEATURES:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Larger units_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Larger hexes_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Additional Sturmgesch_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;uuml;tz brigades and Tiger Tank battalions in the order of battle._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; All Panzer and Panzergrenadier divisions, Soviet Tank and Mechanized Corps now have a 3rd step (remnant unit)._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Simple, classic igo-ugo system._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;OLD FEATURES THAT HAVE BEEN RETAINED: _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Russian Tank Army and Shock Army capabilities _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Soviet massed artillery _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; German Tiger tanks_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; air power_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; differing capabilities for Marshal Zhukov and General Manstein_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; and Zone of Control Bonds_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;COMPONENTS (2nd edition)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; full-color counters (one and a half counter sheets)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; *Two full-color mapsheets creating a 36.5_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; x 34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; playing area_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 28-page Rule Book _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; 5 full-color Player Aid Cards (2 Combat result/Terrain effect chart, 3 At Start/Reinforcement cards)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Two 6-sided dice _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;TIME SCALE 5 days per turn_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;MAP SCALE 10 miles per hex_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;UNIT SCALE Primarily divisional._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;NUMBER OF PLAYERS One or twoDESIGNER: Mark Simonitch_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;DEVELOPER: Tony Curtis_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;MAP ART: Mark Simonitch_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;COUNTER ART: Mark Simonitch_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;(source: GMT website and user's description)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

GMT Games (GMT000615) On August 3rd, 1943, less than two weeks after the Kursk offensive, the Soviets launched a massive offensive near Kharkov that ripped open the German line. The ensuing battle began their summer offensive that would take them across the Ukraine to the Dnieper River. During August the two sides were equally matched and a tremendous war of attrition raged from Kharkov to the Sea of Azov with neither side willing to give ground. In September, bled white by the never-ending Soviet attacks, the German army retreated in haste to the safety of the Dnieper River. In October, the battle raged along the length of the Dnieper and for the Perekop Peninsula, the only land exit to the German 17th Army in the Crimea. During this three month period German reinforcements poured in from every sector, but it was never enough. Three Soviet Tank Armies and four Soviet Fronts ground through nineteen panzer and panzer grenadier divisions. German and Soviet losses were staggering. Kiev, the capital of the Ukraine, fell on November 6th. Ukraine _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;43 attempts to simulate this important campaign in a moderately complex game. The design uses the conventional move-fight-exploit sequence of play and the popular Zone of Control Bond rules. Soviet tank armies and German panzer corps spearhead constant attacks and counterattacks. With both sides able to attack, the game becomes a tense battle of skill and nerves. The 2nd Edition has been re-designed to play much faster using the system used in France _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;40 and Normandy _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;44. Players familiar with those games will find the new Ukraine _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;43 very easy to learn. All the components will be upgraded -- the counters will go from half-inch to 9/16 size, the map will be enlarged so the hexes can accommodate the larger counters, and each scenario will now come with a setup card to facilitate setting up the game.

*** With every sale we donate a percentage to the Veterans Support Foundation (including this sale). *** Wargame Depot has donated over $7,500 to this wonderful cause thanks, largely, to the wonderful Boardgamegeek community. Thank you so much for your continued support of Wargame Depot which has allowed us to give generously to the VSF. Mint, in shrink copy available. No dings, no dents, or anything wrong with the game. Non-smoking environment and kept in a humidity-controlled location. $11 shipping to US - write me for a quote to the rest of the world. I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;m the owner of Wargame Depot so a purchase from me will always be packed professionally and I can accept Paypal, MO/Check, or MC/Visa/Discover/AMEX. And if you want this game plus anything else that I am selling on BGG, I_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;ll of course be happy to add other items on in order to save you on shipping! North Carolina residents pay 7% sales tax. Cheers, Jason PS: We have many Osprey books in stock not listed on BGG. The prices are well under publisher rates; if you are interested in them, please let me know!
